intro: Pilosella blyttiana subsp. latibractea, commonly known as the broad-bract pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the subspecies is distinguished by its broad bracts surrounding the flower heads. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
